alert.note: Alert for Carlton (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 10:10AM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... St. Louis River at Scanlon affecting Carlton County. .Additional snow melt will continue to lead to river flooding and elevated flows. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Louis River at Scanlon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water encroaches buildings near River Gate Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM CDT Monday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below minor flood stage late Saturday evening and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 13.9 feet on 04/23/1979. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu St. Louis River Scanlon 10.5 13.4 Mon 9 am CDT 12.9 12.3 11.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1015 PM CDT.
